I'm Uninstalling this app because it does not include obvious rhymes. Example... I wanted a rhyme for "trial" and the word "mile" was not in the list. That means I cannot trust the app.

As a poet assistant it is excellent. As a dictionary and thesaurus it is American based, not English, so there is a need to be careful as to word usage and spelling in Britain. Otherwise it's a very good app. Free of ads and very useful...
Very much important and very useful app to understand English language. I found out very interesting, easy to use and good user interface. THANKS TO THE DEVELOPERS OF THIS APP !!!

I'm going to give it 5 stars because it does exactly what it should and does it with ease; no ads, no internet connection. It's great. If you write or study this is a must have app. My request is this: 1. I'd like to see the back button not close out of the app, but rather go back to the last selection or menu you've tapped. 2. If like to see the rhyme section have looser options and rhyme schemes (alternative option to toggle). If your a poet, most rhymes aren't going to be precise. Thanks!
This app is the most used app in my phone. I enjoyed all the features.

I can't stress enough how much this is exactly what I needed. Not fancy, doesn't need to be. It would be cool if it was easier to move words around in the text editor, but that's more a problem with the default Android keyboard burying my clipboard history than an issue with the app.

When you search a word, the results are limited to 500 words. They are alphabetically ordered. So depending on your settings, you may only reach the B or C words. I would love for more quick search filters which would let us to choose a letter or set of letters that the word has to begin with. E.g. I'm looking for a word that rhymes with Baby but starts with a W or starts with the letters "TH", i'll be able to do that. Let us input up to entire words in this function instead of having choices.

I want to say that this is seriously one of my favorite apps. Not only does it help while I'm writing poetry but the feature of it reading you're text back to you is phenomenal. I use it all of the time for proof listening to messages, and comments before I send them. (Especially if its a sensitive subject, it can sometimes help me to notice if I sound too harsh or something. Anyways, yeah this app would get 10 0ut of 5 if I could, I lovess ittt.

Great app, but there are two issues with this app. When you tap into search bar, the latest searches hint is in alphabetical order instead of time order. Matches are limited to 500 words and are ordered alphabetically, so sometimes you don't even get past words that start with one of the earliest letters in the alphabet. A solution would be an option to order matches by certain condition like popularity, equal alphabetical representation, random, etc.
This app is worth having just for the offline dictionary and thesauras.

the best app for a writer...!

A reasonable resource, if somewhat clunky. The rhyming feature is first class, however the general logic needs some work. While the first selection of a word appears in all three sections, Rhymer (R), Thesaurus (T), & Dictionary (D), following selections do not carry over to these fields and must be looked up in each section manually. As a prolific poet, I know it is unlikely I will be content with the first rhyme I choose. Pressing back exits the app and clears your history!
Hey its nice. Just one request can you add a feature to download the sound file, please ?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello Sujay! Thanks for the feedback. You can already do this 😊 It's menu -> share poem audio. Let me know if you need anything else! Cheers, Carmen

google_play_reviews.content: Great job

Mostly good, but has a two very annoying problems. One, the back button closes the app instead of going to the last word searched, and when closed it forgets your searches, so you'll have to type the word back in. Two, it makes the occasional odd assumption - for example, when I tried to search "touche" it thought I meant "touched" - and when it makes this mistake, there's no way to "force" it to search only exactly what you type in.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Indeed other users have also suggested making the back button function like this. I'll consider adding this behavior 😊 As for the touche/touched: if a word doesn't exist in the dictionary, it tries to find the "closest" word, based on the word stem. In this case, touche unfortunately doesn't exist in the thesaurus or definitions. 🤷‍♀️

google_play_reviews.content: It's almost good... But it will be better if you make it to connect with the Google account or an ID of the poet Assistant where we can register so that when I got it uninstall and later when I install it.. All the words which I have marked as favourites could come back when I log in to my id...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tashi. Thanks for the feedback! Indeed I should improve the automatic backup of the favorites. For now, a manual backup/restore is possible: In the settings you can export/import favorites.

So far, the rhyming assistant and word of the day features will keep me from deleting this. But the lack of a syllable counter is, IMO, its main weakness. I'm aware that for English in particular, such feature would require the use of an algorithm (unlike say, my native Brazilian Portugese, whose non-phonetic syllables are infinitely easier to guess, even for non-natives), but you might as well pair up with an existing online service rather than paying for one yourselves.

Thanks again, this a fantastic app for writers, also the dictionary is simple and nice for those learning English. The thesaurus is useful too for brain storming.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thanks for the feedback. In the thesaurus tab, you can click on the "D" icon next to a word to open it in the dictionary. The "R" will look up its rhymes, and the "T" will look it up the thesaurus.

google_play_reviews.content: Would be awesome if you filter what kind of rhymes are shown (ig. Strict, exact, loose). Great app but a filter option for results would GREATLY benefit this app.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. In the rhyme tab, there's a filter icon. If you tap it, you can filter the results to only show synonyms of a word you choose. It's pretty basic but might help a bit.

google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Marcos,
Thanks for the feedback! I didn't realize that this could be annoying :)  But I can see it now. There's no option yet to turn this off, but I hope to add it soon (maybe this weekend).
Cheers 🙂

google_play_reviews.content: Helps me out quite abit

I love this app, as it helps me out with rhyming words, and also has a thesaurus. Truly a boon to write well. I especially love the fact that the rhymes are either strict, or loose, and also the synonyms come for each and every usage of a particular word!

The app works fine although may need a little fine tuning on picking up all rhymes. 1 extra filter would make this my beloved app and that's a syllable filter i.e rhymes with can + 2 syllables etc. It's purely convenience as the app already breaks it down nicely in results.

The rhyming dictionary is awful. Lots of words show up as having nothing that rhymes with them. For example, I looked up the word "trauma." No matches. But in reality there are a lot of words that rhyme such as drama, llama & mama.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the specific example! The CMU pronunciation dictionary (the source of the rhymes) has T R AO M AH and D R AA M AH, which is indeed probably too subtle a difference for this app. I'll see if I can treat AA and AO as the same. Have a great day without too much drama or trauma! 😉

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Could you open the settings from the menu, then open "System voice settings"?  Can you see if any voices are installed?  Maybe try selecting a different voice.  Don't hesitate to email me (c@rmen.ca) to give me more details, and I'll be happy to help resolve the problem.  How was the rest of the app? Have a great day :)

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kevin! It looks like you're using version 1.10.2. Since version 1.10.4, only words which have definitions appear in the rhymes results (there's a setting to disable this and show all rhymes). Maybe that could help. I'm interested in your suggestion to sort by syllables. Could you elaborate? Feel free to write to c@rmen.ca if it's easier. Thx!

google_play_reviews.content: Poetry is key to emotion

I've tried all the apps for rhyming and it's simply the best. Hat's off to UI development, it makes the app the most efficient and best in its class. Although just like other websites and apps you can't find all the rhyming words, it still depends on your vocabulary and wordplay ability. After all writing a song is an art and it should be pure💙
This is seriously Amazing! I would suggest everyone having hard time finding rhyming words to write a song or poem. This app is very handy! Kudos to you developers!
Amazing! Thanks!
I love this app so much. But I would request if there can be modification on the voice it comes with or additional voices to suit users.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. The app has no voices built in. It uses the voices already installed on your phone. You can go to the settings and 1) change the voice speed, 2) select a different voice (if your phone has several voices installed), 3) open the system voice settings. If you'd like more voices it can be done from the system settings.

google_play_reviews.content: It isn't reading my poems when I press play, so is there a setting to let me do that? Besides that, the app is completely wonderful!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Jadon,

Can you go to menu:Settings:System voice settings?  Then check if you have voices installed.  Depending on your phone model, there may be an option to test the voices there. If it works fine there, try changing the voice in Poet Assistant settings

Feel free to e-mail  c @ rmen.ca if it might be easier to troubleshoot this issue
